result.execSummary:
The defendant Beatriz Duran was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: No request for early termination of probation.

miscConds.notes:
Pay restitution in the amount of $4,882.32 and restitution surcharge. Restitution is subject to defendant's right to challenge.
----------------------------
*AMENMENT 07/11/2016 - Pursuant to Restitution Hearing held on 07/01/2016 and Order Adopting Findings of Fact, Conclusions of Law and Order Filed 07/11/2016, the defendant has the ability to make restitution and that the restitution owed to S.L.P. is set at $4,810.32. This restitution shall be paid during the defendant's period of probation as directed by her probation agent or as otherwise ordered by the Court.

Pay court costs.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment may be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
----------------------------

No alcohol.   No illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Any prescription medications to be made known to the Agent and taken as prescribed. No violent contact with victim.
----------------------------

IT IS ORDERED, pursuant to Wis. Stats. Sec. 973.015, that upon successful completion of the sentence imposed WITH NO VIOLATION OF THE RULES OF PROBATION, the Clerk of Court shall issue an order expunging the record.
----------------------------

Counseling as recommended by Probation Agent.   Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.   The defendant must pay Department of Corrections Supervision fees.
----------------------------

timeConds.notes: Complete forty (40) hours of community service work during the period of probation ordered and in Walworth County WITHOUT buyout option.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Beatriz Duran

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Findings of Fact, Conclusions of Law, and Order

Court in session 10:40am  
  
ADA Matthew R Leusink appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Beatriz Duran in court with attorney Jeffrey L Hahn.   
Interpreter Saul Artega present for victim S.L.P. and previously sworn.  
Exhibits 1-7 previously marked.  
  
10:43am Susana Landa Pena duly sworn and testifies on direct of ADA Leusink.  
10:45am Exhibits 2 & 5 identified.  Exhibits 2 & 5 offered, no objections and received.  
10:47am Exhibit 6 identified.  Exhibit 6 offered, no objections and received.  
10:48am Exhibit 3 identified.  Exhibit 3 offered, no objections and received.  
10:48am Exhibits 4 &7 identified.  Exhibits 4 & 7 offered, no objections and received.  
10:49am Exhibit 1 identified.  Exhibit 1 offered, no objections and received.  
10:51am ADA Leusink requests the Court to take judicial notice of the criminal complaint, no objection.  Court will take judicial notice.  
10:51am Susana Landa Pena testifies on cross-examination of Atty Hahn.  
11:01am Susana Landa Pena testifies on redirect of ADA Leusink.  
11:03am Susana Landa Pena testifies on re-cross of Atty Hahn.  
11:05am Susana Landa Pena testifies on direct of the Court.  
11:07am Susana Landa Pena testifies on redirect of ADA Leusink.  
11:08am State rests.  
11:09am Defense has no witnesses and rests.  
11:09am Closing argument by ADA Leusink.  
11:11am Closing argument by Atty Hahn.  
11:13am Clarification requested by Court with Atty Hahn.  
11:13am Continued closing argument by Atty Hahn.  
11:15am Clarification requested by Court with Atty Hahn.
11:16am Clarification provided by Atty Hahn.  
11:17am Response by ADA Leusink.  
11:17am Atty Hahn makes a statement regarding DE ability to pay.  
11:20am ADA Leusink requests more clarification of expenses of DE.
11:20am Court will take matter under advisement and issue a written finding of fact and order that will go out within 30 days.
11:21am Court adjourned.
Saul Artega present for the victim S.L.P.
Defendant Beatriz Duran in court with attorney Adam John Johnson.  Matthew R. Leusink appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed.

Defendant Beatriz Duran in court with attorney Adam John Johnson.  Valerian A Powell appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Motion deadline 04-18-16. Bond Remains. Minutes filed.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 17, 2016 at 10:00 am.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for May 19, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Signed bond filed with the court.

"No violent contact" includes threats through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person or through a third party. NO VIOLENT CONTACT WITH S.L.P.   Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

Defendant Beatriz Duran appeared with attorney Adam Johnson, Matthew R. Leusink appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Not guilty plea entered. Trial Reserved. Minutes filed.  Status conference scheduled for December 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Plaintiff's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.  Notice of Motion and Motion for Establishment of Discovery Deadlines.
